Dr. Ritesh Rastogi is an eminent personality in the field of computer science education. He is serving NIET Greater Noida as an Associate Professor and Head of Department Computer Science He has academic experience of more than 25+ years. He did his schooling and Graduation from Dehra Dun.

He did his doctorate in Cloud Computing. He has published more than 50 papers in national/international journals and conferences. He has also authored books and chapters in computer science. He has also been engaged in delivering expert lectures at renowned universities and institutes.

Dr. Ritesh Rastogi has also been actively involved as a Convener in organizing various Conferences/FDPs at the National and International levels. He has also been an Advisory Board/Committee member at various International Conferences. He is currently the member of BOS for CS at NIET, Greater Noida Apart from the academic activities he has also been involved in social responsibilities.

He has also been awarded as “Corona Warrior” and been awarded by companies for his efforts and work in the field of education. He is also a member of professional societies like ISTE, IFERP, C# Corner, IAENG, Oracle Incorp. and many more

name: Amita Shukla
about_description:
Ms. Amita Shukla currently serves as an Assistant Professor in the CSBS Department at Noida Institute of Engineering & Technology, Greater Noida, U.P. Her professional responsibilities encompass teaching diverse courses, including Discrete Structures, Algorithm Design, Web Technology, and Automata Theory.

In addition to her academic duties, she holds the positions of IQAC Coordinator and Proctor and is actively involved in overseeing the school's newsletter "SAMEEKSHA". Ms. Shukla is a dedicated member of organizing committees for national and international events such as Smart India Hackathon, Toyacathon, and conferences. With over 13 years of experience in the teaching profession, she actively engages in research focused on Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML). Her achievements include securing an Indian Patent and publishing research papers in Scopus conferences. Moreover, she has actively participated in numerous Faculty Development Programs (FDPs) and workshops. Ms. Shukla is also recognized as an active member of the IEEE community.

name: Garima Jain
about_description:
Garima Jain, Deputy Head of the CSBS department, is a seasoned professional with six years of experience, including one year in the industry, and a profound commitment to research. She specializes in the dynamic domains of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning (AIML) and Blockchain in Healthcare.

Garima is a prolific researcher with approximately 25 published papers and six book chapters in esteemed journals, indexed by Scopus, IEEE, Springer, Elsevier, Wiley, Taylor and Francis, which reflect her expertise in these cutting-edge areas. Her work has been recognized with a Best Paper Award in an international conference and publication in high-impact factor journals indexed by SCI and ESCI. Notably, she also serves as a dedicated reviewer for Scopus-indexed conferences and contributes her insights to three prominent scientific journals.

In addition to her research accomplishments, Garima is deeply involved in the academic life of the CSBS department, where she has been instrumental in developing innovative curriculum enhancements that integrate the latest advancements in AIML and Blockchain. Her contributions to the department's academic programs have been invaluable, ensuring that students receive a cutting-edge education that prepares them for success in the rapidly evolving fields of technology and healthcare.

about_description:
Dr Poornima Mehta completed her PhD in Computer Science from Jaypee Institute of Information Technology, Noida in 2019. Before that she completed her MSc in Maths followed by MTech in Computer Applications in 1990 (both from IIT Delhi).

Currently working as a Professor in IT department of NIET, Greater Noida. She worked as an Associate Professor in the Department of Computer Science of JSS, Noida for 9 years. Before joining academics, she worked in the software industry for 14 years. Of which she served 5 years in the R & D Division of Centre for Railway Information Systems, Delhi and 7 years in TCS, Noida, where she handled large projects. Her areas of interest include NLP, AI and software engineering.

name: Aditya Kumar Singh
about_description:
Dr Aditya Kumar Singh is presently working as an Assistant Professor in the Department of Electronics & Communication Engineering at Noida Institute of Engineering and Technology (NIET), Greater Noida, Uttar Pradesh, India.

He obtained his B.Tech degree in Electronics Engineering from Institute of Engineering and Rural Technology, Allahabad (Uttar Pradesh Technical University, Lucknow) in 2013 and M. Tech. Degree in Advance Electronics& Communication Engineering with specialization in VLSI Design from Dr A.P.J. Abdul Kalam Technical University, Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh, India in 2016. He qualified Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering (GATE) 2017 .He received his Ph.D degree in 2023 from Department of Electronics & Communication at J.K. Institute of Applied Physics & Technology under the Faculty of Science, University of Allahabad, Prayagraj, Uttar Pradesh, India. He has authored or co-authored more than 35 research papers in international/ national journal/conference proceedings and also granted 5 patents. His research interests include simulation and fabrication of Microstrip Patch Antenna, RF & Microwave Devices and its Applications, Wireless Sensor Network etc. He is a reviewer of conference proceedings like IEEE.

name: Vivek Kumar
about_description:
Dr. Vivek Kumar is associated with NIET, Greater Noida, India as a professor in IT department. He received the Ph.D. degree in Computer Engineering and Technology from Suresh Gyan Vihar University, Jaipur, Rajasthan, India in 2013 with Teaching and Research experience of 23 years.

He did research work on vendor selection through agent, Fuzzy Logic and Case Base Reasoning (Soft Computing). He published papers in several peer reviewed and indexed journals and presented papers in Conferences of national and international repute. His area of interest in research in Applied Machine learning and soft computing. He has Published/Granted patents and books in the fields of emerging technologies like 6G. His current research interests focus on role of Machine Learning (Artificial Neural Network and Deep Neural Network) in Radio waves propagation/6G through Python (Google Co-lab)/Tensor Board/Knime/Azure ML tool/Metlab etc.

name: Megha Gupta
about_description:
My name is Dr. Megha Gupta, and I am currently working as an Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering at Noida Institute of Engineering and Technology (NIET), Greater Noida. I hold a Ph.D. in Computer Science from Guru Gobind Singh Indraprastha University, specializing in Digital Image Watermarking. With over six years of teaching and research experience, I have developed a strong passion for academic excellence, research innovation, and mentoring students.

I have a robust teaching portfolio that includes subjects like C, Data Structures, Algorithms, and Python. Beyond teaching, I actively serve as the M.Tech Coordinator, where I lead workshops, hackathons, and other academic events to foster a culture of innovation and learning among students.

My research interests lie in digital image watermarking, artificial intelligence, and deep learning. I have authored multiple research papers in reputed journals and conferences, demonstrating my commitment to advancing the field. As a dedicated academic, I enjoy guiding students in their learning journeys and contributing meaningfully to institutional growth through my teaching, research, and leadership initiatives.

name: Mohd. Nazim
about_description:
Dr. Mohd. Nazim is working as an Assistant Professor in the Department of CSE, School of Computer Science and IT, NIET, Greater Noida, Uttar Pradesh, India. He completed his Ph.D. from Jamia Millia Islamia (A Central University) [NAAC Accredited A++, and Ranked 3rd in NIRF], New Delhi, India. His research interest lies at the intersection of Software Engineering (particularly software requirements prioritization and selection) and Soft Computing (particularly fuzzy and rough-set based multi-criteria decision-making algorithms).

He obtained his M.Tech. in Computer Engineering in 2015 from Maharshi Dayanand University, Rohtak, Haryana, India [A+ Grade University Accredited by NAAC]. He received his B.E. in Computer Engineering in 2010 from Jamia Millia Islamia (A Central University), New Delhi, India, and Diploma in Computer Engineering in 2006 from the University Polytechnic, Faculty of Engineering and Technology, Jamia Millia Islamia (A Central University), New Delhi, India. He has qualified Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering (GATE) and U.G.C NET in 2017 and 2019 respectively. He is author and co-author of the various research papers published in international/national journals and conference proceedings. He is a reviewer of various conference proceedings.

name: Yusuf Mehdi
about_description:
Dr Yusuf Mehdi is currently an Assistant Professor of English at Noida Institute of Engineering and Technology, Greater Noida, India, where he is involved in teaching professional/business English to the students of Engineering, Computer Application and Management. Earlier, he worked as an Assistant Professor at Jaipuria School of Business (JSB), Indirapuram, Ghaziabad (A Flagship Institute of Jaipuria Group) for about 6 years. At JSB, he was the Chair, Centre for Creativity and Innovation and was also the Faculty In-Charge, Corporate Relations, and Placements. Prior to this, he worked in King Saud University, Saudi Arabia as an Assistant Professor and in ABES IT Group of Institutions Ghaziabad as an Assistant Professor of English. He was also a faculty at Al-Falah College of Engineering and Technology, M.D. University (Rohtak).

Dr Mehdi completed Ph.D in English Language Teaching from Amity University Noida. He is also a Cambridge University certified English Language Teacher as he did CELTA (Certification in English Language Teaching to Adults) from Hampstead School of English, London (University of Cambridge). He is a graduate in English Honours from the University of Delhi; has a master’s degree in English Literature from Jamia Millia Islamia; and an M. Phil in English.

Dr Mehdi has total 26 research papers published in International and National Journals of repute including SCOPUS Listed journals. He has also authored several book chapters, reviews, working papers, etc. He has been on the Editorial Boards and Review Panels of many scholarly journals. As a corporate trainer and executive coach, he has trained and coached large number of teachers and professionals for MDPs, EDPs, and FDPs. He has been a resource person in many workshops and seminars.

name: Himanshu Sharma
qualification: Postdoc, Phd, MBA, M.Tech, B.Tech, Diploma
about_description:
Dr. Himanshu Sharma is currently serving as the Head (R&D) and Associate Professor in the Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering (ECE) at Noida Institute of Engineering & Technology (NIET), Greater Noida, Gautam Buddh Nagar, Uttar Pradesh (U.P), India. He has previously worked as a Postdoctoral Research Fellow in the field of Industry 4.0 at Aalborg University, Denmark, Europe (QS world rank #46) from 2022 to 2023. Dr. Sharma has also worked as a visiting researcher at Aarhus University, Denmark (QS world rank #147). He worked as Assistant Professor (Research) in the Electronics & Communication Engineering (ECE) department of KIET Group of Institutions, Ghaziabad, Delhi-NCR, U.P, India from 2009 to 2021. Presently, he is pursuing an online Executive Master of Business Administration (MBA) degree from the University of Western Australia (UWA), Australia (QS world rank #85). In this joint MBA program, the 1st year classes are provided from Indian Institute of Management (IIM), Kozhikode with professional certifications. He received his Ph.D. Degree in the field of Wireless Sensor Networks (WSN) & Internet of Things (IoT) from Jamia Millia Islamia (JMI)(central govt. University), New Delhi, India in 2019. He completed his M.Tech.in Electronics & Communication (ECE) & B.Tech.(ECE) from the state govt. Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam Technical University (AKTU), Lucknow, U.P, India in the year 2008 and 2014 respectively.

Dr. Himanshu Sharma has been awarded the IEEE Most Read Article award-2021 from IEEE Smart Cities Newsletter, USA in the Year 2022. He has also received the prestigious “Best Faculty Award 2020” from the state govt. Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam Technical University (AKTU), Lucknow, U.P, India, in the year 2020. He has also received the “Sir C. V. Raman Award-2020” from the KIET Group of Institutions, Ghaziabad, U.P. in the year 2020 for the best research papers & patents. He was awarded by Zero Investment Innovation for Education Initiative (ZIIEI) Awards 2020 sponsored by Shri Aurobindo Society & HDFC Bank for his innovative teaching-learning ideas in 2020.

name: Pankaj Kumar Tyagi
about_description:
Dr. Pankaj K. Tyagi, Professor in Biotechnology at NIET, Greater Noida, Uttar Pradesh. He holds a Ph.D. in Drosophila Genetics and Evolutionary Biology, earned from the Department of Biosciences at M. D. University, Rohtak, Haryana, India. With a profound academic background, Dr. Tyagi has authored four books, contributed to 25 book chapters, and published over 95 articles in reputable SCI/Scopus/referred journals. His editorial contributions extend across various domains, as he serves as the editor-in-chief, guest editor, and associate editor for several esteemed journals in Nanobiotechnology, Drosophila Biology, Zoology, Botany, and Toxicology.

Dr. Tyagi's academic leadership is reflected in his supervision of over 100 graduate and more than 20 postgraduate dissertations, including M.Phil and Ph.D. theses. His research primarily revolves around Green Nanomaterial Synthesis and their toxicity, with a focus on safety evaluations in vivo using various species of Drosophila. Recognized for his outstanding contributions, Dr. Tyagi has garnered numerous awards, including the University Research Fellowship and the Recommended UGC Research Award for the period 2014-2016. Notably, he was honored with the prestigious Fellow Linnaean Society London Fellowship Award in 2019-20. qualification: Ph.D., MA(English Literature), BA(English Literature,  Psychology)
about_description:
Dr. Pooja Tyagi is an associate professor in the department of Languages at NIET, Greater Noida. A Post Graduate in English Literature from CSJM University, Kanpur and a PhD from Kalinga University, Raipur Chhattisgarh. She has more than twenty years of teaching experience. She has been teaching English for Specific Purposes to the engineering, pharmacy, MCA and Management students at various levels. She has an expertise in the field of English Language Teaching, presentation techniques and soft skill training. She trains her students for placement purpose and also coaches them for choosing better career options and to be the responsible citizens of the country.

She is a natural elocutionist, who mentors and guides her students at regular basis and solve their problems easily. A multifaceted talent showcases her personality. She combines the strength of steel with the softness and beauty of a rose-such is her personality. Her never say die attitude has pulled her through rough phase of her life. To her obstacles are ways to show how strong she can be.

She is a qualified Speaking Examiner of the prestigious Cambridge Assessment English (BEC) Examinations. She also heads the Cambridge Assessment English at NIET (An authorized centre). She is an active editor of the ‘edit@NIET’ an initiative to help scholars to get their papers edited on the grounds of language to be published in the journals of repute. She is the co-editor of the book ‘Online classroom: Opportunities and Challenges’ (ISBN: 978-81-910756-9-4) published by InSc Publishing House.

Dr. Tyagi is core member of Board of Studies at NIET, a core member of the program and curriculum designing and development. She is the secretary of Women Grievances and Redressal Cell at NIET and also a coordinating member of women empowerment cell at NIET.

name: Benazir Manzar
about_description:
Benazir Manzar is an Assistant Professor in the Department of Languages, Noida Institute of Engineering and Technology, Greater Noida. She has completed her PhD from Indian Institute of Technology (ISM), Dhanbad. Her research deals with the changing mood of the new millennium and its effects on Bombay cinema and youth culture. It reads into the anguish, aspiration and hopes of the generation who reached adulthood in the first decade of the new millennium. Bombay cinema in the new millennium is marked with experimentation, invention and incorporation of ideas that is breaking away from typical narratives. Her research work is published in various reputed journals. She has published her first book Noises Inside, which is a collection of poems. She was awarded first prize in the Essay Competition in the competitive magazine Pratiyogita Darpan, and the essay was published in Pratiyogita Darpan (English). She completed her Graduation and Post Graduation in English Literature from Jamia Millia Islamia, New Delhi. She was selected for NESA undergraduate exchange program during her undergraduate and went to North Central Technical College, Wausau, Wisconsin, USA for a semester program.

Her areas of interest are popular culture, cinema, youth culture, gender and communication. She can be reached at benazir.manzar@niet.co.in

key_project:
As of now there are numerous intrusion detection systems accessible inside the market, yet it is hard to choose the best intrusion detection system for an organization. To choose the equivalent, we have conceived a framework that will assist an organization with choosing the best intrusion detection. The framework comprises of logical advances, and which when pursued uncovered the wanted intrusion detection system. The various factors which are associated with choosing best intrusion detection are as:

  • Risk Analysis.
  • Detection Rate
  • False Alarm Rate
  • Cost Benefit analysis
  • Updates or patches ratio

It was proposed a hybrid model for Intrusion Detection System that consolidates the execution of both the techniques (anomaly and signature) In addition to some additional highlights which will help the detection (positive true) of the attacks made to a system/Network. The name of this system given as One-stop for example which detects all the attacks under a single system, Rule-based will just detect known attacks while Anomaly will check from conduct climate attack exists or not. The hybrid model One-stop has been created keeping in view the quantity of false alarms.

name: Pavan Kumar Shukla
about_description:
Dr. Pavan Kumar Shukla is Professor and Head of the Department of Electronics & Communication Engineering at Noida Institute of Engineering and Technology, Greater Noida and having more than 22 years’ rich academic experience. He has completed his doctorate from the State University, Uttarakhand Technical Unuversity, Deharadun in year 2017 in the field of Digital Communication, Optical Communication and Antenna.

He is also working as the Technical Advisor of the Telenoetica Ltd. Lagos Nigeria, A telecommunication infrastructure provider in most of the African countries. He has published more than 20 research papers in reputed journals and guided many postgraduate projects. He is a nominated expert of the subject "Antenna & EMFT " by the AKTU and delivered many e-shoots for the university students.

His expertise is in the field of communications and also has five patents in the field of antenna and IoT which have been published in the intellectual property of India as the chief investigator. He is a Board of Studies member for many universities, subject expert for many industries and organizations. He has chaired the many sessions of IEEE International conference and panel member for the Electronics and Communication Symposium. He has more than 20 years of academic and research experience. He has also served as Students Activity Council Chairman and Secretary of Alumni Association for more than 10 years. He has obtained multiple grants from AICTE, AKTU, DST, DRDO & from many other govt. organizations to conduct various companies, FDPs and many academic events.

name: S. Pratap Singh
about_description:
S. PRATAP SINGH (Member, IEEE, Fellow IETE, and Member, GISFI) is currently working as a Professor (Research & Innovation) with the Department of ECE at NIET, Greater Noida. Founded Galgotias Center for Experiential Learning Innovation and Incubation (GCELI2) as founder president. At GCELI2, Dr S Pratap has developed two experimental setup towards experiential learning and one experimental setup of BAN.

He is working on various innovations out of which two prototypes are ready for launch of pilot projects. In addition, five innovations are in progressive stage. He has published twenty five research papers in reputed journals of IEEE, Elsevier, Springer, Wiley, and Taylor’s & Francis apart from many more Scopus indexed research papers through different international conferences. He has also published two IPR (three more are under publication) from India and one book chapter ‘‘Multimedia Nano Communication for Healthcare–Noise Analysis”, Internet of Multimedia Things (IoMT), Academic Press, Elsevier. Dr. S Pratap has more than 20 years of experience in research innovation, and academics. The goal of his life is to implement an MNC and/or EMNC system, the application of which ranges from military to medical, information communication to bioinformatics and industry to environment, in short, almost in every aspect of life. His current research interests include modeling, analysis, and mitigation of fading, interference and noise in Wireless Communication and in Nano Communication, which includes Electromagnetic Nano Communication (EMNC) using terahertz band and Molecular Nano Communication (MNC) using molecules via gaseous or aqueous medium. He is a fellow of IETE, India, member of IEEE and member of GISFI, India.

name: Sanjay Kumar
designation: General Manager- International Outreach & Partnerships- NIET, Associate Dean- Innovation Labs & MOOCs- NIET, Dy. HoD & Asst. Professor- School of Mechanical Engineering
about_description:
Born in January 1985 in Distt. Ghazipur, Uttar Pradesh, India; Prof. Sanjay Kumar pursuing his Ph. D from Dr. B. R. Ambedkar National Institute of Technology (NIT) Jalandhar did the M. Tech. from NIET, Greater Noida, the B.Tech. from AKG Engineering College, Ghaziabad, U.P. His research interests include; Friction Stir Additive Manufacturing (FSAM), Friction Stir Welding (FSW), Friction Stir Processing (FSP), Composites, Taguchi Optimization, Gray Relation Analysis, Computer Aided Design and consulting interests: PTC CREO for Design Engineers, Industrial Design & Simulation, 3D Printing, Augmented Reality, PTC PLM Windchill.

Presently working as Assistant Professor & Dy. HoD of Mechanical Engineering, Noida Institute of Engineering & Technology, Greater Noida, U.P. since January 2008. Prof. Kumar possesses 15 years of experience in academics and research. Prof. Kumar has the administrative experience also and serving as General Manager- International Outreach and Partnerships, Associate Dean- Innovation Labs & MOOCs; Coordinator of PTC Centre of Excellence, SPOC-NPTEL/ICT M.Tech. & B.Tech. Admission Committee. He also worked as UG Coordinator, Industrial Visit & Seminar Coordinator, Coordinator of Departmental Students Performance committee in NBA & NAAC, member of Developmental Research Committee. Prof. Kumar has inculcated research culture amongst the Undergraduate & Postgraduate students who have contributed significantly at various national and international forums encompassing FSW, FSP, PTC CREO etc.

In addition to teaching at PG and UG levels, Prof. Kumar has made a significant contribution to R&D in the area of FSW & FSP for fabrication of welded joints and composite materials. He has guided many B.Tech. and M.Tech. Students and has undertaken Sponsored Research Projects of 06 Lakh under Collaborative Research and Innovation Program funded under TEQIP- III AKTU, Lucknow. He has published more than 12 research papers in the International and National Journals and Conferences.

Prof. Kumar brings with him a combination of being a distinguished academician, an exemplary researcher, visionary educational administrator, a professional consultant with a positive attitude and profoundly professional approach for intimate industry interaction. Prof. Kumar has a unique vision of his own for the educational system. He believes in providing malleable and ingenious curriculum having an optimal mix of State-of-art theoretical knowledge, creative practical skills, management, entrepreneurship and sustainable development. He also believes that modernization of infrastructure and faculty motivation is essential for a world-class institution. Prof. Kumar also believes in optimal utilization of resources and advocates for cost reduction in higher technical and vocational education.

name: Sabnam Firdaush
about_description:
I am currently serving as an Assistant Professor at Noida Institute of Engineering and Technology (NIET) in Greater Noida, Uttar Pradesh, India. I completed my B.Tech in ‘Information Technology’ at Women's Institute of Technology in Bihar. Subsequently, I pursued my ‘Master's degree (M.Tech)’ in Information Technology at Birla Institute of Technology, Mesra, Jharkhand. Currently, I am engaged in pursuing my Ph.D. at NIT Jamshedpur in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering.  

With a solid academic foundation, my journey in academia has been marked by a dedication to fostering innovation and critical thinking among my students. In my role as an Assistant Professor, I am responsible for teaching a variety of courses, including Discrete Structures, Algorithm Design, Database Management System, Design Pattern, and Automata Theory. I am committed to imparting practical skills to students through Value Added Programs 

My expertise lies in Artificial Intelligence, Information Security, Machine Learning, Blockchain in healthcare where I actively engage students in cutting-edge research and real-world applications. I believe in creating an environment that encourages curiosity and hands-on learning, preparing students for the challenges and opportunities in the ever-evolving field of engineering. 

To stay at the forefront of engineering education, I actively participate in conferences, workshops, and industry collaborations. Continuous learning is a principle I instill in my students, and I lead by example in embracing emerging technologies and methodologies. Additionally, I have actively participated in numerous Faculty Development Programs (FDPs) and workshops. 

I take pride in mentoring aspiring engineers, guiding them towards academic and professional success. Collaborative projects and interdisciplinary initiatives are integral to my teaching philosophy, preparing students for the interdisciplinary nature of modern engineering challenges.

name: Sandhya Umrao
about_description:
I am thrilled to welcome you to the AI Branch! As the Head of Department,

I am excited about the journey we are about to embark on together in this rapidly evolving field.Artificial Intelligence is not just a buzzword; it's a transformative force reshaping industries, societies, and the way we perceive the world. In our branch, we have the unique opportunity to harness the power of AI to drive innovation, solve complex problems, and create value for our organization and beyond.Our mission is clear: to push the boundaries of AI research and development, to deliver cutting-edge solutions that make a difference, and to cultivate a culture of curiosity, collaboration, and excellence.As we dive into our work, I encourage each of you to bring your creativity, expertise, and passion to the table. Let's embrace challenges as opportunities for growth, celebrate our successes, and learn from our setbacks.Together, we can unlock the full potential of AI and shape a future where technology empowers us to achieve extraordinary things. I am honored to lead this talented team, and I look forward to achieving great things together.

name: Abhidha Kohli
about_description:
Currently serving as an Assistant Professor at NIET, Dr Abhidha Kohli is a doctorate in biomedical sciences from Chang Gung University, Taiwan. She has gained more than 2 years of experience as an assistant professor working with different organizations and approximately one year of experience as an associate academic editor in the field of scientific writing and communication. She has published two original articles from her PhD project in reputed journals like Journal of cellular physiology and Cancer science. Additionally, she has contributed and published book chapters in the field of medicinal plants and their traditional knowledge and exploring bioactive components for various antipathogenic activities as a faculty member.

Her research interests include understanding the role of heat shock proteins/stress response proteins in cancer drug chemoresistance, exploring the molecular association between obesity and cancer and understanding the role of housekeeping processes for fighting diseases, such as role of autophagy/mitophagy in cancer chemoresistance. She has been actively participating in conferences and symposiums.

Her research profile includes 40+ research papers on image processing, wireless communications, machine learning, & 6G. Written book chapters on IoT, and ML and has 7+ patents to her name out of which one is granted. Currently working on an IIT Roorkee sponsored project on AIML & IoT and completed AKTU sponsored project under TEQIP -II CRIP. She has supervised 7 PG students and appointed guide for 2 Research scholars for PhD.

As a convener her profile includes successful conduction of International Conferences, AICTE sponsored FDP and STTPs, Training and skill enhancement programs for students, Hackathons and many other. SPOC for AWS Educate program, DLT labs, Swift program and Faculty moderator for GDSC program.

name: Veena Grover
about_description:
Dr. Veena Grover is currently working as Professor in Department of Management at Noida Institute of Engineering & Technology, Greater Noida, UP, India. Prior to this, she worked as Professor in School of Business, Galgotias University. She has more than 21 years of teaching experience in educational institutions of repute like Lingaya’s University, New Delhi Institute of Management, University of Delhi, DAV Institute of Management etc. She is Gold Medallist & University topper in Economics. She has got many appreciation letters & research awards for her teaching, research & administrative skills over the years.

Her research interests include Micro Finance, Sustainability, Macro Economic Variables and Innovation Strategy. Dr. Veena Grover earned her PhD from Department of Business Administration, Deenbandhu Chhotu Ram University of Science & Technology, Murthal (Sonipat). Her proficiency has garnered international recognition, evident through her role as an adjunct faculty member & Thesis supervisor at Westford University, UAE. Her influence extends to the global academic stage, where she has been invited as a distinguished panelist, keynote speaker, and session chair at several prestigious conferences, summits, and seminars.

A prolific researcher, Professor Grover has contributed significantly to the academic discourse by presenting and publishing more than 35 research papers and book chapters in esteemed international and national conferences, as well as reputable refereed journals. She serves as an Editor of the refereed journal, International Journal of Advanced Trends in Technology, Management & Applied Science & Reviewer of International Journal of Applied Behavioural Economics. She is also a member of Sustainable Environment and Ecological Development Society (SEEDS) working towards achieving Sustainable Development Goals. She is also Innovation Ambassador under Ministry of Education to mentor & implement innovative projects & startups in educational institutions.

name: Abhishek Pratap Singh
about_description:
Dr. Abhishek Pratap Singh holds a PhD in Mechanical Engineering from The NorthCap University, Gurugram. His thesis was titled "Computational Analysis of Pollutant Dispersion Mechanism in an Urban Street Canyon". He also has an M.Tech in Robotics Engineering from MDU Rohtak, a B.Tech in Mechanical Engineering from UPTU Lucknow, and a Diploma in Mechanical Engineering from BTE UP.

He has over 18 years of experience in academics, spanning university, autonomous, and affiliating institutions. His academic role encompasses teaching, learning, project guidance, administration, and research. He has taught various courses in mechanical engineering. His specializations include robotics and automation, CAD and CAE software, 3D printing, and design and engineering simulations. He has guided more than 40 B.Tech and 5 M.Tech projects, as well as 6 industry projects. Dr. Singh is proficient in various software, including SOLIDWORKS, 3D printing, ROBOGUIDE, ROBOANALYZER, ARDUINO, PLC, AUTOCAD, ANSYS, Technomatics, MATLAB, and SOLIDEDGE.

Dr. Singh has held various administrative responsibilities throughout his academic journey, including Deputy HoD, IQAC Coordinator, NAAC and NBA Coordinator, and coordinator roles for projects, examinations, ranking cell, audit, course review, and other activities. He has also played a leadership role in designing program curricula for automation and robotics, and has been involved in NBA and NAAC accreditations, conducting industrial MoUs and developing VAC courses on robotics and 3D printing. He has been certified in various disciplines, including RPA by UiPath, Startup India, Automation by Mitsubishi, ANSYS, Mindbox, and Autodesk. He has organized and attended several Faculty Development Programs (FDPs), conferences, workshops, and webinars. He has also received various awards and appreciations from different organizations. He also has been granted two patents, published one book, 18 international journal papers, and eight conference papers. He has reviewed papers for conferences and is an active reviewer of journal articles. He has executed seven industrially sponsored projects.

name: Ritesh Kumar Singh
about_description: Dr. Ritesh Kumar Singh is a prolific writer and multi-disciplinary researcher. He is a  UGC NET (English ) qualified, Assistant Professor, and has done his Ph.D. from Mahatma Gandhi Central University, East Champaran.  Intending to establish 'Refugee Literature' and "Concept(s) of Duality" as a true and distinct genre and niche study. He has published 6 Research Papers in high-impact factor National and International journals and has three books to his credit. He has been teaching communicative English, research methods, and advanced English for the past one year. Dr. Singh is currently working at NIET, Gr Noida, as an Assistant Professor, in the department of Languages.

research_profile: Dr. Ritesh Kumar Singh's research focuses on the themes of identity, displacement, and violence, particularly in the context of refugees and postmodernism. Dr Singh's research demonstrates a strong interest in the intersection of identity, displacement, and postmodern theory. His work sheds light on the experiences of refugees, the representation of marginalized groups in literature and mythology, and the evolving nature of postmodernism in a globalized world.

Lakshmi Kumari is an accomplished Assistant Professor of English in the Department of Languages at NIET, Greater Noida. She holds a Master’s degree in English from Banaras Hindu University (BHU) and is GATE-qualified with an impressive All India Rank (AIR) of 93.

name: Nidhi Mehta
about_description:
Dr. Nidhi Mehta is currently teaching at NIET, Greater Noida as an Assistant Professor. She has an extensive experience in teaching English Literature and English Language for around 12 years. Earlier, she has worked in Amity University, Lucknow Campus for 5 years, where she was Ph.D co-ordinator and taking classes for PhD (Eng), M. Phil, M.A. and B.A. students along with business communication for other departments. She has taught communication skills/soft skills in various engineering colleges in different parts of the country.

She has worked on the topic “A Comparative Study in the Poems of Sylvia Plath and Kamala Das” for her doctoral thesis from Allahabad University. An essay of one thousand words has been published in an International Online Journal Plath Profiles- Vol 3 (Indiana Univ. USA), poem “The Wordsmith” and research papers have been published in The Enchanting Verses International, few poems in Muse India an online journal. She was also managing the poetry based article section for http://www.theenchantingverses.org/ (an online journal), poem “Origami of Life” was published in an international journal “Literary Laundry.”

Dr. Mehta has published around 20 research papers and 10 articles in UGC recognised and Scopus indexed National and International journals/conferences. She has been on Editorial Boards and review Panels of many scholarly journals. She has also authored a book on the confessional poetry of Sylvia Plath and Kamala Das. She has also delivered guest lectures as a resource person in different colleges. She has also won gold medal in Swayam NPTEL certification course in Soft skills teaching.

name: Hina Koser
about_description:
Hina Koser is a committed Assistant Professor in the Department of Languages (English) in Noida Institute of Engineering and Technology, Greater Noida, with 3 continuous years of teaching experience. She has previously taught at Chaudhary Charan Singh University, Raghunath Girls’ Post-graduate College, and Meerut Institute of Engineering and Technology, contributing significantly to student learning and academic development.

A NET-qualified scholar, Hina is the author of several widely acclaimed literary works, including Rainbow: A Sneak into Vikas Sharma's Novels, Epiphanies III, and Epiphanies IV. These books are widely recognized and integrated into the academic curriculum for students of English Literature, underlining her scholarly contributions.

Hina delivered a talk as a resource person on the National Education Policy 2020, focusing on revamping all aspects of 21st-century education. Additionally, she pursued and was certified in a research writing course offered by the U.S. Department of State, further strengthening her research and pedagogical expertise.

She has attended more than five Faculty Development Programs, integrating the acquired knowledge into her teaching methods. Her active participation in over 40 national and international conferences, seminars, and workshops has enriched her professional growth and continues to inspire her students in developing critical thinking, communication, and soft skills essential for their success.

Hina is currently pursuing a Ph.D. and remains dedicated to advancing her academic and professional journey.

about_description:
Ms. Anjali Devi is serving as trainer of English in the department of Languages in N.I.E.T. Greater Noida. She is Adept at tailoring lesson plans to suit individual learning styles, encouraging active participation, and building learner confidence in speaking, writing, and comprehension.

Ms. Anjali is a research scholar in the department of English and Modern European Languages in Gautam Buddha University, Greater Noida. Her research focuses on the portrayal of female archetypes in OTT series and movies and their transformation from canonical texts. From her research, she seeks to create an awareness of how popular media influence the identity of women and how society perceives them. Her interest lies in feminist criticism, archetypal criticism and cultural studies.

name: Dolly Sharma
about_description: Dr. Dolly Sharma, Ex Lead Scientist and Trainer in Drug Discovery and Cheminformatics, is an experienced researcher specializing in biorelevant small molecules targeting cancer. Her work includes G-quadruplex targeting, tumor glycolysis, metal complexes, DNA origami, and the synthesis of nanoparticles for therapeutic applications. She has expertise in target- and fragment-based drug discovery, biological activity assays, and cancer cell metabolism. With three registered patents and over 10 high-impact publications in international journals, she has made significant contributions to drug design and nanodevices. Her extensive patent experience highlights her innovation in cancer treatment through advanced synthesis techniques and novel drug development strategies.

research_profile: The research focuses on target and fragment-based drug design and discovery aimed at treating various cancers, including pancreatic, breast, and head & neck cancers, by targeting the cellular energetics of cancer cells as opposed to healthy cells. It involves the design and synthesis of small drug-like molecules that inhibit enzymes or proteins overexpressed in cancers, inflammation, and malaria. Additionally, the synthesis of small molecules as G-quadruplex binders is explored to target cancer, bacterial diseases, and drug resistance. The work also includes basic research into the microwave-assisted synthesis and green chemistry of small molecules, as well as the identification of plant-based natural products with potential therapeutic applications.

name: Theertha T
about_description:
Theertha T is a conscientious teacher that brings a multidisciplinary perspective to English education. Holding an MA in Literary and Cultural Studies from EFLU, Hyderabad, she focuses on integrating insights from social sciences and humanities into teaching. Her research interests include the intersections of language, culture, and society. She is passionate about equipping students with the tools to excel in both academic and professional spheres, and committed to creating an inclusive and interactive learning environment that empowers students to achieve their full potential in English communication.

Dedicated to fostering effective communication among students, she is particularly inclined towards those facing challenges in English proficiency. In addition to this, the area of interest lies in employing innovative, fun, and engaging classroom activities to build confidence and fluency, tailored to meet the needs of diverse learners.

name: Veenita Rai
about_description:
Veenita Rai is a research scholar in the Department of English and Modern European Languages, University of Lucknow. Her research work focuses on the representation of mental illness in Indian English Literature. Her areas of interest include Medical Humanities, Health Humanities, Disability Studies and mental health issues. Through her works, she aims to offer a critical and empathetic perspective to these topics, bringing about greater awareness and understanding.

Currently serving as an Assistant Professor at N.I.E.T., Greater Noida, Ms. Rai brings a dynamic approach to teaching by emphasizing the development of effective communication skills among future professionals. With a passion for bridging academic rigor and industry relevance, she integrates practical applications into her classroom strategies. Her goal is to inspire students to excel not only in their academic pursuits but also in their professional endeavors, equipping them to contribute meaningfully to their chosen fields.
